meanings.meaning: Essentially the same as P0136, P0137 refers to the second oxygen sensor on Bank 1. P0137 means the O2 oxygen sensor's voltage remained low for longer than 2 minutes. This, is interpreted by the ECM as a low voltage condition and sets the MIL. Bank 1 Sensor 2 is located to the rear of the catalytic converter and should produce an output signal relative to oxygen storage capacity of the catalytic converter. This rear (sensor 2) sensor is less active than the signal produced by the front sensor. However, if the ECM senses the sensor is inactive, this code will set.

causes.cause: Faulty o2 sensor Exhaust leak near the rear sensor
High resistance or open on O2 signal circuit
Short to voltage on O2 signal circuit

descriptions.description: Oxygen O2 Sensor Circuit Low Voltage (Bank 1, Sensor 2)

solutions.solution: Check for restriction in catalyst and replace as necessary
Repair exhaust leak near the rear sensor
Repair short, open, or high resistance on o2 signal circuit

symptoms.symptom: There may be no visible symptoms to the driver, other than the MIL (Check Engine / Service Engine Soon) illumination.
